Posts.Content: Feb 1, 2010 05:49AM justpayton1 wrote: I had a lot of pain w/ taxol...it started about 2 days after the infusion. I took ibuprofin(sp) and that did help also baths w/ epson salt...I found I had the most pain on the top of my feet like all the bones. Weird I know..so if I sat for awhile it was painful to get up..another trick I used was to soak my feet w/ warm water and epson salt each night while I watched t.v. Towards the middle after the 2nd dose I did start to swell mostly my ankles and feet..I ended up on Lasix( a water pill) and that helped.. The Taxol was easier to handle as far as it didnt affect my taste or smell like the Ac.. I did do dose dense so that may have affected me different..I was told by my chemo nurse that dose dense and taxol is not a great idea.. Big Hugs to you

Posts.Content: Aug 1, 2010 11:13AM justpayton1 wrote: ((Diane)) I finished tx Oct 09 ( cancer free) Feb 10 my pet scan lit up my internal mammary,supraclavcular,mediasonal and axillary nodes. On March 15th after a month of waiting I was declared StageIV. I had almost 5 months of NED. Just a quick dance. My boy's are 14 and 11.. I share your concerns w/ Avastin. I am not currently on it but it would/could be an option for me. I am TN also. I just finished up Gemzar/Carbo and last Tuesday was supposed to start Gemzar alone every 2 weeks, I was unable to b-c after 21 days my platelets were still only 50,000. Now I will go back this Tuesday to hopefully start my new "life" program.. I will be thinking of you Wednesday.. Diane you aren't alone..we are all here for you..keep us updated Hugs and prayers God Bless You

Posts.Content: May 19, 2010 03:08AM justpayton1 wrote: so very sorry to hear this. Please feel free to PM me ANYTIME you may need to. Like I said I was 4 months out and my scan showed mets in the left internal mammary, supraclavacular, axillary and the mediasinal nodes. I was thrown back into treatment w/ Gemzar and carboplatin. Its all still a blur at times. I showed up for my pet scan yesterday ONLY to be informed it's today?!?!?!? That was enough to send me into a brief meltdown. I am BRCA 1 so my Onc is looking for a PARP for compassinate use once I finish my chemo. My Onc deals w/ University of Chicago and also Northwestern. I have the name of the Big Shot at Northwestern if you would like it. I just wanted you to know I am here anytime you may need. Hugs

Posts.Content: May 30, 2010 08:16AM - edited May 30, 2010 09:49AM by justpayton1 My friends just looked at me funny when I would say chemo brain. Mine lingered even after chemo and now I am back in so watch out!! Anyway I found an article that said chemo brain can last up to 5 years depending on the chemo and course of treatment. I tore that out and carried it in my purse. You should have seen the look on my friends face when I had "proof"... I am a natural smart a&&..so I think my friends didnt think I was serious.. But I forget things..i walk in circles some days..my b oys love it bc i will take away something..as in you just lost your cell phone for the next 2 days but than I forget to take it..3 days later I will remember..

Posts.Content: Jul 20, 2010 05:45PM justpayton1 wrote: Hi T, I had a lmx last summer (july 13th 09 ) I had 13 nodes removed..so I know exactly what you mean about the weird numbness. It did go away although I am not sure when (chemo brain) I could barely stand to touch that area. I also had rads and had to apply lotion daily. I about went through the roof not because of pain but it was just soo weird feeling. It does go away but it did take awhile. I never used an electric razor,was just real careful w/ the regular one. the intuition is very nice..i would highly recomend it. I am also a D cup and wish a had a bmx..(long story..i am BRCA 1 so I would have had no problem but didn't get the results in time prior to sx) At 1st I was okay w/ the mx but since living this way a year I am really sick of it. I hate wearing a bra and now I am forced into it. I can't even go check the mail w/o "fixing " myself. Anyway nice to meet you

I will be starting a "maintaince program" of Gemzar the 27th of this month. I will remain on that until further notice. For me chemo is my only option. Posts.Content: Oct 31, 2010 11:04AM justpayton1 wrote: I am bumping this up w/ my story... I always loved Oct...prepink days. My Mother passed from BC on Oct 10,1976 at the age of 30. I was 6 years old at the time. She had wrote me letters and once a year when I got older, I would get them out, sit out on the deck, have a glass of wine and read over them. I love the fall..the crisp air..the colors..football..mums..the smell of leaves burning in a distance and being outside has always made me feel closer to my Mom. I don't talk much about all this anymore since being dxed w/ BC myself..I can't bring myself to read her letters w/o breaking down..her words to me have become my words to my boy's..and sitting here 34 years later I have never felt closer to her. So English...you have somehow managed to reach thru the computer and heal my heart..you gave me a new way to remember my Mother and Grandmother and to share this w/ my boys... I would also like to add my youngest son was born Oct 10,1998..his orginal due date was Sept 28th..I used to tell him his Grandma gave him a great big hug before she sent him down to me..thats why he was late getting here. Anyway thanks so much for this idea and I will be thinking of you all tonight

Posts.Content: Apr 2, 2011 10:03AM justpayton1 wrote: Jenn, I have also recently begun the 12 hour pain med ( morphine) w/ a 4 hour ( again morphine) for break-thru. I also take 2 Aleve every 12 hours and Zantac to help w/ acid reflux. I was thrown into all this after about 5 weeks of extreme pain. I ended up in the hospital to get it all under control. Anyway I just wanted to add that it does take some time to get the meds working I believe they told me 72 hours. But I know exactly what you are feeling when you say you were pain-free for an hour. I have been on my meds for a month now and there are days I only need 1 pill for the break-thru pain and I feel like dancing. I have adjusted the timing of my meds so that I am able to drive my boys to school in the am and than I come home and take the 12 hour. I don't drive in the afternoon yet as I am not really trusting of my reflexes depending on if I need to take anything for the break-thru pain. I am happy to hear you are feeling better and you had a fun time w/ your Mom and sister. If you ever need to talk feel free to PM me anytime

Posts.Content: Mar 5, 2011 12:00PM justpayton1 wrote: Thank-you all again and again for all your support.. I AM HOME!!!!!!! as a bonus parting gift I was given oxegan. Bleck..but I am home and hooked up to my new leash..my fur baby seems confused :)) she also was scared of the machine which is in my bedroom but didn't leave my side the whole night nor this morning so far. The pain still under control and I will start my Halaven Tuesday..I will join the thread. The PARP is not obtainable for me as of yet..So Halaven here I come!! Once again thanks for all the kindness, love and support...you are all truly "family" Now I will settle into my normal Sat routine as they boys are done w/  b-ball the are up, fed and now plying xbox..as for me I am in the recliner, hooked to my leash w/ my "girl" by my feet. It is wonderful being home...

I just recently cancelled my trash service as the produced a "pink cart" I found myself offended at the very site of this thing. Of course when I called to cancel they were shocked that I a woman w/ breast cancer wouldn't be thrilled over this. It's 25.00 for the cart...5 smacks goes to the ACS( another sore subject) Anyway I second guessed myself and worried that my whole neighborhood would be litered w/ pink carts. You know what only 1 person has this cart and I proudly wheel my green cart to the curb. You aren't alone. I agree w/ Elizabeth that the paintings are shallow. I would also like to add I nevr thought of Magneta as a mature color..please. welcome back Hugs

The preferenece would be a PARP( still looking in all corners for one of those) I will try to check in later..laptop hurts my legs..so I will have to figure out how to rattle..jiggle the tray across my lap..

Posts.Title: An Apology and a Question LC815 Heidihill

Posts.Content: justpayton1 wrote:  I have been battling a "mystery back pain" for 4-5 weeks now. It started as a deep throbbing in my lower back. I blamed it on shoveling..2days later I knew I was in trouble as the pain became unbearable. I called my Dr ( who was on vacation) but I went in and they ran a urine sample and concluded I had a UTI. I started my antibiotics but the pain never fully went away. I was alternating advil/tylenol 24/7. They following week I was back at the Dr. they ordered an x-ray..it showed nothing. They gave me Vicoden for the pain that now had spread to the front of my legs, my knees, and even my arms. It hurt even to rest againest the arm rest in the chair. The Vicoden alone didn't cut it so again added in Advil. They ordered a ct..showed nothing. Well this past Tuesday I had my routine pet/ct scan ( every 4 months for me) I have my answers and they suck.. My cancer has spread to my liver,right supraclavicular,medisonal,right hilar,and upper abdominal lympth nodes. I have a small left pleural effusion. Also findings highly suspicious for diffuse osseous metastatic diease( ribs and sternum) some crap going on w/ my left hilum they are suggesting that is looking like metastatic crap also. I am completely numb.. I spent last night just looking at my boys (14&12) I have been a single Mom since 98. I don't know how to tell them or even if I should. My Onc assures me that we still have options..I will go back next Tuesday to discuss those.( My platelets have dropped to 34,000 so I couldn't do tx any sooner anyway) Meanwhile I will be starting a new pain med. I forget the name but its a 12 hour and than I can use the Vicoden for any break thru pain. My Dad will be coming back to stay w/ me for a few days to help w/ the boys as I adjust to my new meds. I just had to get this out..like I said I feel completely numb. I wasn't expecting this at all. Flipping cancer Dx 2/9/2009, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, 2/13 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Finally some answers and they aren't good justpayton1 chainsawz

Posts.Content: Feb 23, 2011 09:42AM justpayton1 wrote: Thank-you everyone for your kind words.. Heidihill-I am not on any antibiotics for the pleural effusion. I will ask about that. The pain medicine I am waiting on is morphine..now how did I forget that??? I have to get a pre-cert from the insurance( which only takes about 20 minutes) but doesn't help when the pharmacy "sits" on the script. I have been on the phone this morning w/ my nurse to make sure its taken care off today. Still numb which is a blessing at this point. I think I am in a state of shock as when my Onc started rattling things off..my mind kept saying okay thats enough..enough..ENOUGH!! So first things first..pain under control..new game plan and than talk to my guys.

Posts.Content: Jun 17, 2010 08:03PM justpayton1 wrote: We are on the same chemo...I am finishing on July 6th but that leaves me at 6 cycles. I will be facing a scan than and also treatment decisions. The Gemzar/Carbo has worked wonderful for me also and I tolerate it fairly well. I have begun running into platelet issuses. So I don't think a 7 or 8 cycle would be an option for me at this point. I don't know what to tell you other than you and Olga are in my thoughts and prayers.. I would also wait for the scan...fingers and toes crossed for you both.
Posts.Title: Dilemma - to pause or not to pause. leprechaun ElaineD

Posts.Content: Jul 21, 2010 08:36AM - edited Jul 21, 2010 08:44AM by justpayton1 Nicole, I am also afraid to be off chemo w/ good reason I might add. But I will say this when I was dxed in March this year w/ mets I was put back on chemo finished that and am moving on to another chemo. If and when I am offered a break or "chemo holiday" as they call it..I will take it. My reasons are this...I am 40 years old and have to boys that I am rasing by myself, I need to be able to get them to school, practices, make them dinner and in general be a Mom. That is what gets me through my day. I have no husband or other so its just my guys and myself. I worry about the long term effects chemo will have. I look forward to my "holiday" were I can just focus on myself and my boys..and not worry about appointments every other week etc...I don't look at it as not fighting BC, I look at it as taking a much needed break and coming back stronger to continue to knock the p!ss out of this disease.
Posts.Title: New, need advice... nmiller1978 nmiller1978

Posts.Content: Jul 8, 2010 11:30AM justpayton1 wrote: Please forgive me in advance if I am off base here. I am answering this while suffering from a severe headache but I wanted to add. I get purple dots when my platelets are low..I have had them appear on my arm( the 1st time) My stomach( the 2nd) my shoulder (the 3rd) They pop up out of the blue it seems. The first time I was sitting outside and just glanced down at my arm and there they were.. I know how scary it can be...I thought I was having an allergic reaction and freaked.. Call your Dr. maybe suggest a cbc. thinking of you

Posts.Content: Jul 13, 2010 10:27AM justpayton1 wrote: (((Lynn))) i am so sorry you are going through all this right now. I am echoing the Ativan/ Xanax.. It is sooo very maddening when things don't go how they should. I have had my share of things falling apart..hell they "lost" my blood for my BRCA test, they had to redraw and than "sat" on paperwork for weeks that needed a signature..So here I sit uniboobed b-c of things I just couuldn't control. I didn't have the results in time before sx. I have arrived 24 hours early for my pet scan --sigh-- I guess I am just trying to let you know you aren't in this alone. We all have had are days..weeks or moments. Thats why I come here b-c I know someone always "gets it" Now I get myself quite "nutty" before a scan. Angry..screaming at everyone and everything..than crying at commercials...more yelling...walking...cleaning..crying over and over and than I remember my Ativan and I take it. Than I will ask myself why the heck did I wait sooo long???? Hang in there..listening and sending hugs

Posts.Content: Oct 30, 2009 08:36AM justpayton1 wrote: yes the silvadene cream is the BEST!! I had to complain for 2 days before my rad onc prescribed it. I had problems with the area under my arm. There is also a type of bandage they can give you there. I cant remeber the name but it is a self stick deal and actually helps with the weeping but at the same time keeps the right balance of mositure in. I had to demand this too.  Now depending on your area it may be tricky to keep it on.. if your are dealing with the under arm area you can also buy athletic self stick tape. ( it has no glue and sticks to itself) It can be found at Walmart, Walgreens etc...Now the trick is to wrap it around your body to hold the bandage on. For me because I am by myself.. I found this both amusing and frustrating. Hope this helps

Posts.Content: May 31, 2010 09:12AM justpayton1 wrote: {{ Stephanief }} i was just recently thrown into stage 4 ( March 15 ) Like Cathy..this time around I have not told many people.( I am on Gemzar/Carbo and still have my hair.) I just feel this is really between me, my parents, and my children. I have no husband. I look good..feel pretty good..and for the most part don't want to talk about "my cancer" unless I choose too. Somedays I hide from the world and others I jump right in...somedays I feel so good i cry and somedays I feel so bad I scream..sometimes I feel so blessed for the people in my life and others I feel so alone as if no one gets it. Right now I am feeling alone so I jump on these boards, so I see that I am not.. Your feelings are totally normal and you are truly not alone keep us updated
